detaileddescription.para: X raster-space coordinate of this ray tree
Y raster-space coordinate of this ray tree
X image-space coordinate of this ray, in [-1,1)
Y image-space coordinate of this ray, in [-1,1)
path index (or light sample index for shadow rays)
total number of samples to take
recursion level for the ray that created this hit
absolute time, between shutter-open and shutter-close
bucket that the pixel being rendered belongs to
surface derivative wrt screen X-axis (not normalized)
surface derivative wrt screen Y-axis (not normalized)
smoothed normal (same as N but without bump)
array of active lights at this shading context
distance from P to light source
unoccluded incoming intensity from light source
in AI_CONTEXT_SURFACE this is the world-space area being shaded; in AI_CONTEXT_DISPLACEMENT it's the average area of all un-displaced triangles shared by the current vertex
surface derivative wrt U parameter (not normalized)
surface derivative wrt V parameter (not normalized)
ray direction derivative wrt screen X-axis (not normalized)
ray direction derivative wrt screen Y-axis (not normalized)
derivative of surface normal with respect to X-axis
derivative of surface normal with respect to Y-axis
U derivative wrt screen X-axis (not normalized)
U derivative wrt screen Y-axis (not normalized)
V derivative wrt screen X-axis (not normalized)
V derivative wrt screen Y-axis (not normalized)
if true, don't trace shadow rays
trace-set to assign to rays made from this SG

An AtShaderGlobals structure represents a shading context that holds all the information accesible to the different types of shaders. For example, after a camera ray hits the surface of an object, a shading context of type AI_CONTEXT_SURFACE is created that contains, amongst other things, local geometric properties such as the surface normal, the UV surface parameters, etc.
